Storage: 

 " - Always refrigerate perishable food 
" " within 2 hours (1 hour when the 
" " temperature is above 90 °F). 
" " - Cook or freeze fresh poultry, fish, 
" " ground meats, and variety meats 
" " within 2 days; other beef, veal, 
" " lamb, or pork, within 3 to 5 days 

"
Thawing: 

 " - Refrigerator—The refrigerator 
" " allows slow, safe thawing. Make 
" " sure thawing meat and 
" " poultry juices do not drip onto 
" " other food. 
" " - Cold Water—Place food in a leak- 
" " proof plastic bag for faster 
" " thawing. Submerge in cold tap 
" " water. Change the water every 
" " 30 minutes. Cook immediately 
" " after thawing. 
" " - Microwave—Cook meat and 
" " poultry immediately after 
" " microwave thawing.

" Preparation: 

 " - Always wash hands with soap 
" " and warm water for 20 seconds 
" " before and after handling food. 
" " - Do not cross-contaminate. Keep 
" " raw meat, poultry, fish, and their 
" " juices away from other food. 
" " - After cutting raw meats, wash 
" " cutting board, knife, and counter 
" " tops with hot, soapy water.
" " - Marinate meat and poultry in a 
" " covered dish in the refrigerator. 
" " - Sanitize cutting boards by using a 
" " solution of 1 tablespoon of 
" " unscented, liquid chlorine bleach 
" " in 1 gallon of water.

" Cooking Temperature: 

 " - Cook all raw beef, pork, lamb and 
" " veal steaks, chops, and roasts to 
" " a minimum internal temperature 
" " of 145 °F as measured with a 
" " food thermometer before 
" " removing meat from the heat 
" " source.
" " - For safety and quality, allow meat 
" " to rest for at least three minutes 
" " before carving or consuming.
" " - Ground meats: Cook all raw 
" " ground beef, pork, lamb, and 
" " veal to an internal temperature of 
" " 160 °F as measured with a food 
" " thermometer.
" " - Poultry: Cook all poultry to an 
"
" internal temperature of 165 °F as 
" " measured with a food 
" " thermometer.


"
Kitchen Hacks: 


1. Peel garlic with a jar lid: Place the garlic clove on a flat surface, put a jar lid on top of it, and press down firmly. This will easily separate the garlic from its skin. 

 2. Freeze leftover herbs in olive oil: Chop up leftover herbs and place them in an ice cube tray. Fill the tray with olive oil and freeze. This creates a convenient way to add herbs to soups, stews, and sauces. 

 3. Ripen bananas in the oven: If you need ripe bananas for a recipe but only have unripe ones, place them on a baking sheet and bake at 300°F for about 15-20 minutes. This will help ripen them quickly.


"4. Soften butter in a ziplock bag: If you need softened butter for a recipe but forgot to take it out of the refrigerator ahead of time, place the butter in a ziplock bag and pound it with a rolling pin until it's soft. 

"
"5. Use a muffin tin for portion control: Use a muffin tin to portion out ingredients like chopped vegetables, cheese, and nuts. This makes it easy to add the right amount of each ingredient to a recipe.

"
"6. Keep brown sugar soft with a slice of bread: Place a slice of bread in a container with brown sugar to keep it from hardening. The bread will absorb the moisture and keep the sugar soft. 

"
"7. Use a citrus juicer for pomegranates: Cut a pomegranate in half and place it in a citrus juicer. This will easily separate the seeds from the flesh, making it easier to use them in recipes.

"

Ingredient Substitutions: 

 Meat Alternatives: 
 " - Pea Protein 
" " - Tempeh 
" " - Seitan 
" " - Jackfruit 
" " - Tofu 
" " - Lentils 
" " - Black Beans 
" " - Chickpeas 
" " - Plant-based meat products

" Milk Alternatives: 
 " - Almond milk, Soy milk, Oat milk, 
" " Coconut milk 

" Butter Alternatives: 
 " - Coconut oil/Olive oil: 1:1 (Olive oil 
" " in cooking, not baking.)
" " - Avocados 
" " - Bananas (in baking) 

" Cheese Alternatives: 
 " - Add nutritional yeast to recipes 
" " that need a cheesy flavor. 

" " • Soft cheese: 
" " - Soak cashew nuts overnight and 
" " blend them with a bit of nut milk 
" " and lemon juice as a cream 
" " cheese alternative. 
" " - Blend soft silken tofu with salt and 
" " spices as a nacho cheese 
" " alternative. 
" " - Thin slices of smoked tofu can 
" " replace provolone cheese for 
" " sandwiches. 

" " • Hard cheese: 
" " - Crumbling hard tofu and baking it 
" " with salt and truffle oil. 

" "Alternative for one egg: 
" " - 1/4 cup of applesauce 
" " - 1/4 cup of banana, pumpkin, or 
" " avocado puree 
" " - 1 tablespoon of ground chia 
" " seeds with 3 tablespoons of 
" " water 

"
Baking soda / powder alternatives: 
 " - 1 teaspoon of baking powder - 1⁄2 
" " teaspoon of cream of tartar 
" " and 1⁄4 teaspoon baking soda 
" " - 1 teaspoon baking soda - 3 
" " teaspoons baking powder
